div.p: The official URL for this implementation guide is:
FHIR Implementation Guide to exchange functional performance data and assessments between post-acute care (PAC) and other providers, patients, and key stakeholders

description.value: FHIR Implementation Guide to exchange functional performance data and assessments between post-acute care (PAC) and other providers, patients, and key stakeholders

A point in time collection of post-acute care observations for a patient. This profile is used for exchanging a set of observation data collected through the use of a structured resource (e.g. assessment tool, instrument, or screen).

name.value: Functional Performance Narrative History of Status

description.value: An exchange of summary observation regarding the most recent prior status immediately preceding the current admission, illness, or exacerbation for a patient. The use of this profile is encouraged in the absence of formal prior level assessments. For formal assessments conducted with for example, an assessment instrument, use the PAC Collection and PAC Observation profiles to capture assessment data.

An exchange of post-acute care observation for a patient. This profile is used for exchanging a single observation data generally included in a set of observation data collected through the use of a structured resource (e.g. assessment tool, instrument, or screen).

A record of an assistive device--e.g. eyeglasses or hearing aid, being used by a patient during a post-acute care observation. This profile based on the DeviceUseStatement resource provides a way to include information about device usage during an assessment.

Associated with the Narrative History of Status profile to provide a high-level indication of assistance required for the person’s baseline ability (status immediately preceding the current admission, illness, or exacerbation for a patient). The CMS Assessment answer list LL4309-2 provides possible values for this extension.

Associated with the PAC Collection profile to point to a record indicating what healthcare-related assistive device was used by a patient during an observation. This extension leverages the DeviceUseStatement resource instead of Device resource so as to indicate appropriately a record of assistive device usage by a patient.
This extension is used to indicate the principal physical location where an observation event occurred.
Codes for the classification of functional indicators.

name.value: Functional Performance Functioning Category Value Set

description.value: Codes for the classification of patient observation. This is an extension of the ObservationCategoryCodes value set
This value set contains all of LOINC and SNOMED CT.
Codes for functional performance categories

name.value: Functional Performance Functioning Category Code System

description.value: Defining a specific code for the classification of patient observation regarding individual's functioning.

This Capability Statement defines the expected capabilities of a PACIO Functional Performance FHIR server conforming to the PACIO Functional Performance Implementation Guide.
